Class Engine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
MVC.simu.framework.Engine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IEngine
Direct Known Subclasses:
MyEngine
public abstract class Engine extends Thread implements IEngine
Abstract base class for the simulation engine.

The Engine class controls the overall execution of a discrete-event simulation. It manages the event list, simulation clock, timing loop, and coordination between ServicePoints and the controller (IControllerMtoV).

Subclasses such as MyEngine define the domain-specific behavior of events, initialization, and results processing.

Core responsibilities:

  • Maintains the simulation clock and event list
  • Executes events in chronological order
  • Manages service points and their queues
  • Provides pause, resume, and stop functionality for GUI control
  • Delegates specific event handling to subclass-defined methods

  • Field Details

    • eventList

      protected EventList eventList
      The global event List used to store and process simulation events.

    • servicePoints

      protected ServicePoint[] servicePoints
      Array of service points representing different processing stages in the system.

    • controller

      protected IControllerMtoV controller
      Controller interface for updating the GUI and communicating with the view layer.

  • Constructor Details

    • Engine

      public Engine(IControllerMtoV controller)
      Constructs a new Engine instance with the given controller. Initializes the simulation clock and event list.

      The service points themselves are created by subclasses such as MyEngine.

      Parameters:
      controller - the controller interface used for GUI updates and view synchronization

  • Method Details

    • setSimulationTime

      public void setSimulationTime(double time)
      Sets the total simulation time.
      Specified by:
      setSimulationTime in interface IEngine
      Parameters:
      time - the time at which the simulation should stop

    • setDelay

      public void setDelay(long time)
      Sets the delay (in milliseconds) between simulation events. Used to slow down the simulation for visualization in the GUI.
      Specified by:
      setDelay in interface IEngine
      Parameters:
      time - the delay duration in milliseconds

    • getDelay

      public long getDelay()
      Returns the delay between events in milliseconds.
      Specified by:
      getDelay in interface IEngine
      Returns:
      the current delay value

    • run

      public void run()
      main.Main simulation loop.

      Initializes the simulation, then repeatedly processes events until the simulation time limit is reached or no events remain. Supports pausing, resuming, and stopping via GUI controls.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • tryCEvents

      protected void tryCEvents()
      * Checks each ServicePoint for waiting customers and starts service if idle.

      Subclasses may override this method to implement custom service-start logic.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the simulation loop.

      The engine remains in a waiting state until resume() is called.

      Specified by:
      pause in interface IEngine

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the simulation loop after being paused.
      Specified by:
      resume in interface IEngine

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation permanently. Once stopped, it cannot be resumed.
      Specified by:
      stopSimulation in interface IEngine

    • isStopped

      public boolean isStopped()
      Returns whether the simulation has been stopped.
      Returns:
      true if stopped, false otherwise

    • initialization

      protected abstract void initialization()
      Defines the initialization logic for the simulation.

      Must be implemented by subclasses (e.g., create arrival processes, initialize queues, generate first events, etc.).

    • runEvent

      protected abstract void runEvent(Event t)
      Defines how a specific event should be processed.

      Each subclass implements this method to handle domain-specific event behavior.

      Parameters:
      t - the event to be executed

    • results

      protected abstract void results()
      Defines how the simulation results should be processed after the run completes.

      Typically includes aggregating statistics, detecting bottlenecks, and persisting results to the database or GUI.
